attributes.action: Not spam email us about road charging.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The London Standard reports that Tony Blair's office is preparing to email the 1.4 million (so far) signatories of the Stop Road Charging petiton to explain the governments view point.

This is a total waste of time and effort since those who have signed have made it clear they oppose road charging.

This email will be nothing more than unwanted spam and only the abandonment of road charging would be acceptable.

We ask the PM to abandon this futile PR stunt.

rejection.details:
The email has been sent as per the faqs:
http://petitions.pm.gov.uk/faq
reasons: Statements that don't actually request any action
Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
